item.title: Wacom introduces the Wacom MobileStudio Pro, designed for demanding creative tasks
item.description: Wacom is launching the Wacom MobileStudio Pro, a new line of mobile computers designed for professional creatives who work on the go. These lightweight computers feature Wacom’s latest pen technology, including the new Wacom Pro Pen 2. With four times the accuracy and pressure sensitivity of its predecessor, the Wacom Pro Pen 2 makes the MobileStudio Pro a powerful tool for 2D, 3D, and CAD artists and designers. item.title: LAVISH is bringing a new standard of high-end catering to Singapore
item.description: The renowned catering company, LAVISH, celebrated its 18th anniversary with a gala in late January. The event served as a platform for the brand’s revitalization and showcased their forward-thinking approach to catering, blending culinary arts with technology and science. item.title: In the corporate hierarchy, creative roles are gaining prominence
item.description: The increasing prominence of design-led thinking in business and strategic problem-solving is benefiting creatives’ careers globally. A 2016 Adobe survey of over 1,700 creatives, including graphic and web designers and artists, revealed that these professionals feel they are making a bigger impact within their organizations. Over half of respondents in the Asia Pacific region (56%) reported a greater impact compared to two years prior, with 89% stating that their companies now place more emphasis on creativity and design thinking.
